item.title: Visualizing NYC Department of Corrections Daily Inmate Records
item.description: In March of 2012, then Mayor of New York City Michael Bloomberg signed into law an amendment to city code mandating that all “public data” be made available on a single public portal: NYC Open Data. A neat summary of the history behind the law and legislation like it can be found in this 2017 article for govtech.com. Since then, public data out of NYC has been used in a slew of neat projects.
